description: Researchers at the Institute of Continuum Mechanics of the Ural Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences in Perm studied the surface properties of magnetic fluids, which are used in targeted drug delivery and various technological fields. They measured the surface tension of a magnetic fluid in a magnetic field using a modified capillary wave method, achieving an accuracy of several nanometers.
original: The surface properties of magnetic fluids were studied in Perm. Magnetic fluids are artificially created colloidal solutions, which have no analogues in real nature. Along with fluidity and viscosity, they also demonstrate sensitivity to external magnetic fields. Modern magnetic fluids are used for targeted delivery of drugs and are in demand in various fields of technology. Employees of the Institute of Continuum Mechanics of the Ural Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences (branch of the Perm Federal Research Center Ural Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences@permsc) for the first time measured the surface tension of a magnetic fluid in a magnetic field, which does not require corrections for various magnetic effects, which can mask the dependence under study. For this, the authors used the capillary wave method, significantly modified by the authors - a classic method known since the beginning of the 20th century, but not used everywhere in world practice. A unique method of wave excitation and analysis of the resulting profiles, measured with an accuracy of several nanometers, made it possible to use it to study biological fluids and liquids in external fields. For more information, visit the RAS website.

event: Russian Prosecutor General's Office Demands Return of Ivanovo Heavy Engineering Plant
description: The Russian Prosecutor General's Office has demanded the return of the Ivanovo Heavy Engineering Plant (IZTS) to the state, citing illegal privatization in the 1990s. The office claims that the privatization damaged the country's defense capability. As an interim measure, the court has arrested the shares and property of the enterprise.
original:
Forwarded from: Strategic Missile Forces
The Russian Prosecutor General's Office demanded the return of the Ivanovo Heavy Engineering Plant (IZTS) to the state. The supervisory agency came to the conclusion that the enterprise was privatized illegally in the 1990s. According to the prosecutor's office, the decision to transfer shares of the defense IZTS was made by unauthorized persons and organizations and without the permission of the Russian government, which is obligatory in such cases. As a result, the privatization of the plant, according to the Prosecutor General's Office, damaged the country's defense capability. As an interim measure, the court arrested the shares and property of the enterprise. — “Kommersant” The Ivanovo Heavy Machine Tool Plant was founded in 1953 for the serial production of boring machines; the first stage of the enterprise was launched in 1958. By the beginning of the 1980s, the enterprise became one of the main ones in the Soviet machine tool industry. Its products have been supplied to organizations in the aerospace, defense, automotive and energy industries. In addition, the machines were exported to Germany, Italy, Sweden, Finland, Japan and other countries.

In the 1990s, the enterprise was privatized and transformed into OJSC Ivanovo Heavy Machine Tool Plant. In 1998, Vladimir Bazhanov became general director. The plant remained the largest enterprise for the production of high-tech machine tools and was one of the backbone enterprises in Russia. In 2008, there was a fire at the plant, after which it began to have financial difficulties.

In 2011, the company became a guarantor for a loan from Avangard Bank issued to the Bigabum gambling company, which soon went bankrupt. As part of the loan, the bank took the woodworking and foundry buildings of the plant. Let us recall that at last year’s address to the Federal Assembly, Vladimir Putin identified the oligarchs as posing a threat to our country. “On February 29 there will be a message from the president,” said State Duma deputy Stanislav Naumov during parliamentary hearings on the topic of legislative providing support for the children's goods industry in the Russian Federation on Monday.@rvsn_na_washingtonZen|VK|OK|YouTube|Rutub

event: Demonstration of LD-35 Air Defense System
description: At the World Defense Show 2024, NORINCO showcased a new modification of its LD-35 air defense system, featuring an integrated laser weapon, anti-aircraft missiles, and a 35-mm cannon. The system's radar, OLS, and fire control system enable effective combat against traditional targets and modern unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs).
original:
At the World Defense Show 2024, the Chinese company NORINCO demonstrated a new modification of its LD-35 air defense system.

The key difference between the new modification of the LD-35 is the presence of an integrated “laser weapon” in addition to anti-aircraft missiles and a 35-mm cannon (which contains not only simple ammunition, but also ammunition with programmable detonation). The combat vehicle is equipped with both radar and OLS, which are integrated with a set of weapons using a single on-board fire control system. The system can be operated by both autonomous machines and batteries.

Having such a wide range of integrated weapons and detection means, the new modification of the LD-35 can quite effectively (including economically) combat not only traditional targets for systems of this class (airplanes, helicopters, guided missiles, large UAVs), but also a variety of modern “unmanned trifle” of the battlefield (here laser means are especially effective in terms of the cost of disabling small UAVs) using the optimal option for the task.

A good example of the logical modernization of existing military air defense systems for a new type of target over the battlefield, while maintaining capabilities for traditional tasks.#ChinaMilitary Informant

event: Reduction of Excise Tax on Petroleum Gas
description: The Lithuanian Parliament, responding to farmer protests, reduced the excise tax on liquefied petroleum gas from €304 to €13 per ton, effective March 1. The move was a key demand of the protesters, who had seen the tax increase from zero to €304 per ton on January 1.
original:
Forwarded from: Geoenergy INFO
The Seimas of Lithuania, at the request of farmers, reduced the excise tax on petroleum gas by 23 times. The Parliament of Lithuania at an emergency session met the demands of protesting farmers and reduced the excise tax on liquefied petroleum gas by more than 23 times, from €304 to €13. At the meeting, 108 parliamentarians voted for this, 55 abstained. Nobody voted against it.

“From March 1, the excise tax on liquefied natural gas will be €13 per ton,” the Seimas press service reported.

A reduction in excise tax was one of the main demands of the protesters. From January 1, it was increased from zero to €304 per ton. After the protests, when more than 1,300 tractors came to Vilnius from all over the country, Prime Minister Ingrida Simonyte admitted that the increase in excise tax was disproportionate. At an extraordinary session, the government proposed reducing it to €41 per ton.@geonrgru|YouTube

description: Moses Robinett, Joe Biden's great-great-grandfather, stabbed and killed John Alexander, a civilian employee of the northern army, during a fight in a dining tent at the Army of the Potomac camp near Beverly Ford, Virginia. The conflict was sparked by statements made by a distant relative of Biden about the deceased.
original:
Biden's great-grandfather stabbed a fellow soldier to death during the Civil War and was pardoned by Abraham Lincoln, the Washington Post reports, citing archives.

The murder took place 160 years ago - March 21, 1864 at the Army of the Potomac (North) camp near Beverly Ford, Virginia.

In one of the dining tents, a fight broke out between civilian employees of the northern army, Moses Robinett, who was Biden’s great-great-grandfather, and another civilian, John Alexander. Biden's grandfather took a knife and killed Alexander.

It is reported that the cause of the conflict was statements made by a distant relative of Biden about the deceased.

Robinett was convicted and sentenced to two years imprisonment and hard labor. Familiar officers submitted a petition to Lincoln to overturn the sentence, and he supported it. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

description: Defector Maxim Kuzminov, who stole a helicopter and surrendered to the Ukrainian Armed Forces, was allegedly found dead with multiple gunshot wounds in Villajoyosa, Spain. However, the authenticity of the report is disputed, and there is no solid evidence to confirm his death.
original:
The main sensation on February 19 was the information about the death of the traitor Maxim Kuzminov, who was allegedly hiding in Spain. The body of the former pilot was reportedly found with multiple gunshot wounds in the municipality of Villajoyosa in Alicante.

Let us recall that on August 9, 2023, the captain of a separate helicopter regiment, Maxim Kuzminov, stole a Mi-8AMTSh and crossed the front line and surrendered to the Ukrainian Armed Forces. Two other members of Kuzminov's crew were killed; there is a version that the captain personally shot them. For betraying the Motherland and his colleagues, Kuzminov received 500 thousand euros from the Ukrainian special services.

Kuzminov’s death was confirmed by Andrey Yusov, a representative of the Main Intelligence Directorate of the Ukrainian Defense Ministry. There were reports of multiple gunshot wounds and being run over by a car. However, it is possible that this is another fake of Ukrainian propaganda. There is no solid evidence that it was the traitor who was shot. According to Spanish press reports, the Ukrainian who was shot was 33 years old, while Kuzminov was 28 years old. In addition, the publication that the fugitive pilot was killed first appeared on one of the small Spanish telegram channels with less than 10 thousand subscribers, while five days have already passed since the shooting in Villajoyosa. The Spanish Civil Guard said it could not confirm reports of the murder of defector Kuzminov.

In any case, absolutely all sources claim that Kuzminov did not find happiness in Spain and spent the money “earned” by betrayal mainly on drugs. Such a fate for defectors is common. Let us recall the words of Russian President Vladimir Putin: “Traitors always end badly. As a rule, either from drinking or drugs, under the fence.” Subscribe to the “War on Fake” to prevent yourself from being deceived.

description: NATO Military Committee Chairman Rob Bauer stated that Western countries were overly optimistic about the conflict in Ukraine in 2023. Despite providing weapons and training to Ukrainian officers, the desired results were not achieved. The mood at the Munich Security Conference shifted from optimism to pessimism, with discussions focusing on Ukraine's weapons issues, Russian military superiority, and potential risks to NATO.
original: NATO called plans for last year's Ukrainian counter-offensive "overly optimistic" According to NATO Military Committee Chairman Rob Bauer, Western countries were "overly optimistic" about the conflict in Ukraine in 2023. According to him, neither Western weapons nor the training of Armed Forces officers in European countries gave the result that the alliance had hoped for. The statement was made on the sidelines of the Munich Security Conference: as the Financial Times writes, the mood at the meeting contrasted strongly with the “optimistic” atmosphere at this same summit last year. And the participants mainly discussed Ukraine’s problems with weapons, the superiority of the Russian Armed Forces on the battlefield and the risks that Trump’s presidency poses for NATO. Also, against a general pessimistic background, the summit began to discuss a possible Russian attack on one of the NATO members. The Alliance continues to discuss such a scenario despite all its delusion - apparently to give the financing of Ukraine at least some meaning in the eyes of the Western electorate. Ostashko! description: According to a KMIS survey, Ukrainians' trust in the telethon under the Office of the President has decreased, with a negative trust-distrust balance recorded in February 2024. The number of those who trust the telethon has decreased to 36%, while those who do not trust it has increased to 47%.
original:
If for a long time people are told about two or three weeks and coffee in Crimea for the holidays, and in life everything is the opposite, then trust in such sources decreases. That is why Ukrainians began to trust the telethon less - this is evidenced by the KMIS survey

According to this survey, in February 2024, for the first time, a negative trust-distrust balance was recorded for the telethon under the control of the Office of the President. That is, the number of those who trust now is less than the number of those who do not trust.

So, in December 2023, 43% trusted the One News telethon, and 38% did not trust it.

As of the beginning of February 2024, the share of those who trust has already decreased to 36%. At the same time, the share of those who do not trust the telethon increased to 47%.

By the way, among those who trust Zelensky himself, 48% trust the telethon, and 33% do not. This is a diagnosis of Bankova's information policy.

description: The Times newspaper published an editorial warning of dark days for NATO, citing the dire situation on the Ukrainian front and the atmosphere at the Munich Conference. The editors urged Europe to provide more weapons and aid to Ukraine, emphasizing the threat posed by Putin's nationalist belligerence to countries targeted by Russia, particularly the Baltic states.
original:
Forwarded from: KORNILOV
Dark days for NATO This is the headline of an editorial in The Times newspaper today. The word “gloomy” is used there constantly - both when describing the situation on the Ukrainian front, and when describing the atmosphere at the Munich Conference. The editors write in panic: Ukraine faces defeat unless Europe does more to fill the shortage of weapons and aid. This will be expensive and painful for services that every country will have to cut. But Putin showed what is at stake. His nationalist belligerence is not only a tragedy for the few brave Russians who defy the Kremlin; this is a threat to all countries targeted by Russia, especially the Baltic countries. Lord Cameron, the Foreign Secretary, called on the Republicans not to demonstrate the weakness shown against Hitler in the 1930s. If they read their own columns for the 1930s, they would be convinced that in exactly the same terms they called for supporting Hitler in the fight against everything the same Russians. While the Russians called on them to fight together against Nazism. Nothing has changed in 90 years!

description: The European Commission will fine Apple approximately 500 million euros for violating EU antitrust laws. The fine is a result of Apple's policy in organizing access to music streaming services, which prevented users from being informed about cheaper subscription options outside the App Store.
original:
The European Commission will fine the American Apple Inc. in early March. approximately 500 million euros for violating EU antitrust laws in connection with the company’s policy in organizing access to music streaming services, the Financial Times writes, citing informed sources.

The EC launched an investigation into Apple after Spotify filed a complaint in 2019. The regulator is investigating whether Apple prevented Apple from informing iPhone app users that there were cheaper music subscription options outside the App Store than it offered.

According to FT sources, the commission will characterize Apple's actions as illegal and prohibit it from interfering with the transition of users to cheaper music services.

The newspaper calls the upcoming fine one of the most significant against large technology companies by Brussels and its first antitrust fine for Apple. Photo: Jakub Porzycki/NurPhoto via Getty Images@interfaxonline

description: A live broadcast with People's Deputy of Ukraine Dmytro Razumkov will discuss various topics, including the postponed law on mobilization, delayed 'booking for money' decision, blocked accounts of evaders, persecution of journalists and opposition, and introduction of new taxes to finance defense needs.
original:
Today, Monday, February 19, at 7:00 p.m., we will broadcast with People's Deputy of Ukraine Dmytro Razumkov

- The law on mobilization is postponed again due to lack of votes and corruption risks. what to expect and when?

- Servants, with the support of Bankova, seriously want to delay the "booking for money" decision. What are the consequences of this decision and what are the chances of adopting such a law?

- After the information that the accounts of evaders will be blocked, a record amount was withdrawn from personal bank accounts. What will happen next and how to attract people to the army?

- In the West, the situation with the persecution of journalists and the opposition is closely monitored. The partners started talking about the lack of democracy in Ukraine. Can this situation harm Ukraine in terms of funding from the EU? But will we have new scandals related to suppression of freedom of speech?

- The government is considering the introduction of new taxes to finance defense needs. It is surprising that there is still no tax on corruption. What is the government thinking?https://youtube.com/live/e61Js0ZuvHo

description: The conflict in Ukraine has led to a significant increase in orders for the US military-industrial complex, with a cumulative growth of 17.5% in production since the beginning of the conflict. The US has also become the world's largest exporter of liquefied natural gas, with over $80 billion in arms deals in the past year, including $50 billion to European allies.
original: The Wall Street Journal: Thanks to the conflict in Ukraine, the US military-industrial complex is experiencing a sharp increase in orders. The number of orders is growing from the Ministry of Defense and European allies, the publication reports. In addition, Europe's refusal to supply Russian gas after the outbreak of the conflict allowed the United States to become the world's largest exporter of liquefied natural gas. Since the beginning of the conflict, the cumulative growth in production in the American military-industrial complex was 17.5%. According to analysts, the growth rate in the sector over the past few years is comparable to the previous 20 years. <...> According to the State Department, in the one year through September, the United States entered into more than $80 billion in arms deals, of which approximately $50 billion went to European allies, more than five times the historical norm. Subscribe to Telegram SOLOVYOV !

description: The GUR confirmed the death of Maxim Kuzminov, a traitor who hijacked a Russian military helicopter. However, the story of his liquidation in Spain is disputed, with some sources claiming it was a Ukrainian special services operation, while others believe it was a hoax to throw off his real location.
original:
🇷🇺⚡️Reports of the Novorossiya militia Z.O.V. (DPR, LPR, Ukraine, War)❗️The GUR confirmed the death of Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked a Russian military helicopter and condemned him to...🇪🇸🇺🇦It turns out to be a funny story with the traitor Maxim Kuzminov, whom many telegram channels hastened to kill in Spain.

At the suggestion of the Spanish resource Eureka news, which shared an ironic version and rumors about the “drug addict and alcoholic Kuzminov,” who became a dangerous obstacle to the Ukrainian special services, the story of the mysterious liquidation was first believed by the Spanish and Italian media, and then by Ukrainian telegram channels.

The story had a real basis - last Wednesday, an unknown 33-year-old Ukrainian citizen was actually shot in the city of Alicante. However, there is no real evidence of Kuzminov’s death.🔻A small Spanish telegram channel, not believing its luck, eventually attracted everyone’s attention, and now they are trying to use its humorous stuffing in the State Intelligence Service of Ukraine in order to hide Kuzminov’s real location and throw the bloodhounds off the trail.

What can be done in this situation? Find Kuzminov for real and make this story a reality."Rybar"TelegramEureka newsCanal de información geopolítica independiente🇪🇸https://twitter.com/EurekaNews10🇬🇧https://twitter.com/Eureka_News_ENGVIEW CHANNEL

description: Azerbaijani Telegram channels spread misinformation about Ukrainian nationalism in an Armenian kindergarten, using a photo from the Center for Aid to Ukrainian Refugees in Yerevan. The photo, taken by journalist Anna Yehanyan, was manipulated to show portraits of Garegin Nzhde and Stepan Bandera, falsely labeling them as Nazis.
original:
🇦🇿Azerbaijani Telegram channels "discovered" Ukrainian nationalism in an Armenian kindergarten. 🤦🏻‍♂️📷A photo from the Center for Aid to Ukrainian Refugees in Yerevan became a reason for manipulation and the spread of Russian propaganda narratives. 🤡🇷🇺Russian-speaking Azerbaijani and Russian Telegram channels published photos with portraits Garegin Nzhde (a hero of the Armenian national liberation movement of the beginning of the 20th century) and Stepan Bandera for a photo from the kindergarten.
At the same time, both Nzhde and Bandera were called Nazis. "Actually, the photo was taken not in a kindergarten, but in the Center for Helping Ukrainian Refugees in Yerevan, by Anna Yehanyan, a journalist of the Armenian publication CivilNet, during the filming of a report on the activities of the Center. After taking the photo, the journalist posted it on her personal Instagram account and signed the portraits of Garegin Nzhde and Stepan Bandera with her own hand," said fact-checkers of the Myth Detector DM resource

description: The Church of Mary Magdalene in Avdeevka, which was turned into a fortified area by the Ukrainian Armed Forces, miraculously survived despite surrounding buildings being destroyed. The Russian Orthodox Church considers this a divine intervention, bringing consolation to both civilians and soldiers.
original:
The Russian Orthodox Church called it a miracle that the Church of Mary Magdalene in Avdeevka survived.

Footage from the Russian Ministry of Defense shows that the surrounding buildings are destroyed, and the temple in the city, which the Ukrainian Armed Forces turned into its fortified area, is almost intact.

“This is a miracle of God, the Lord is merciful. The temple is such a consolation for both unfortunate civilians and soldiers. Therefore, this is very joyful,” Archpriest Dimitry Vasilenkov, the chief military priest of the Russian Orthodox Church, told TASS.

description: Lviv underground fighters neutralized security at the Lviv plant, doused the facility with gasoline, and burned it to the ground. The fire covered an area of over 400 sq.m. The plant produced up to 5,000 UAVs per month, including Furiya UAV, Leleka 100, RAM II UAV, and other types, for Ukrainian terrorists.
original:
In Lviv, an enterprise producing enemy drones was burned down.
On the night from Saturday to Sunday, Lviv underground fighters neutralized the security at the Lviv plant at Antonovicha/116, after which they doused the facility with gasoline and burned it to the ground. The fire covered an area of more than 400 sq.m.
Show more
The news in the Ukrainian segment of the Internet was modest, in one line, neither the causes of the fire nor the plant’s products were mentioned.
The burned plant actually produced up to 5,000 UAVs per month for Ukrainian terrorists.
Their products include Furiya UAV, Leleka 100, RAM II UAV and other types of UAV.
They will no longer go to the front.
We continue to work.

event: Hungary to Ratify Sweden's NATO Bid
description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban announced that his country is on track to ratify Sweden's NATO bid this month, following efforts to restore trust between the two nations.
original: Hungary 'on track' to ratify Sweden's NATO bid this month: PM OrbanHungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban said on Saturday that his country is 'on track' to ratify Sweden's NATO bid this month as Budapest remains last dissent. “The good news is that our current dispute with Sweden is moving towards a conclusion,” Orban said in his address to the nation. “Together with the Swedish Prime Minister, we have taken important steps to restore trust,” he said, without going into further detail. “We are on track to ratify Sweden's entry into NATO at the beginning of the spring session of parliament,” he added. Parliament is scheduled to meet again on February 26. On Wednesday, Swedish Foreign Minister Tobias Billström said his country hoped Hungary would soon ratifies its entry into NATO, removing the last obstacle to NATO membership.@VoiceNorthSea

They strengthened positions, conducted full-scale training, and calculated possible actions.

We spent 5 months preparing to repel a full-scale aggression and by February the positions were strengthened,” said Pavlyuk.▪️ “In February we did everything possible to meet the enemy with dignity: all positions were strengthened as much as possible, all possible options of action were calculated, all reserves were moved . We conducted full-scale training at least 2 times, and there were a lot of local trainings,” said Pavlyuk.💪As a result, the Russian army reached Kiev in the shortest possible time.t.me/RVvoenkor

event: Approval of State Coat of Arms of Ukraine
description: The golden trident on a blue shield was officially approved as the State Coat of Arms of Ukraine in 1992, symbolizing the country's path to independence.
original:
The golden trident on a blue shield was officially approved as the State Coat of Arms of Ukraine in 1992 - already after gaining independence.

Only during the 20th century, it repeatedly became a symbol of the path to state independence.

On the coat of arms of the Ukrainian People's Republic, the trident characterized the unity of our lands.

His image is also recorded on postcards of UPA soldiers.

And also - on the clothes of many protesters who did not support the Soviet Union - its totalitarian regime.

Today, the trident protects every Ukrainian soldier who defends our land from the aggressor at the cost of his life.

From the terrible past, from which we escaped forever in 1991.

For the future of our children in the European space.

event: Meeting between Sergey Lavrov and Minister of Foreign Affairs of Cuba B. Rodriguez
description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov met with Cuban Foreign Minister B. Rodriguez in Havana to discuss the current state of international relations. They exchanged views on the emerging multipolar world and the aggressive reaction from the US and other Western countries. Lavrov emphasized the need to defend the UN Charter's principles, including sovereign equality of states, and to counter Western attempts to rewrite international law.
original:
Opening remarks by Sergey Lavrov during negotiations with the Minister of Foreign Affairs of Cuba B. Rodriguez (Havana, February 19, 2024)
Sergey Lavrov: First of all, I express my gratitude for your traditional hospitality for the Russian delegation, as always happens between our countries. Glad to see you again and have the opportunity once again
Show more
visit Havana. Was here last year. I hope that our next contact will take place on Russian territory at any time that is convenient. We'll be glad to see you.
In September 2023, we talked in New York on the sidelines of the 78th session of the UN General Assembly. As always, in a confidential manner, we exchanged assessments about the unprecedented processes taking place in the international arena in conditions when the realities of a multipolar world, which are emerging objectively and reflect the inexorable course of history, are not just being tested, but are causing an aggressive reaction from the United States and other countries of the world minority, which are all by hook or by crook they want to maintain their dominance, hegemony, dictatorship. The means that American and other Western representatives resort to for this purpose include not diplomacy, but blackmail, ultimatums, threats, the use of brute military force and sanctions.
Cuba knows firsthand what illegal pressure is, a total embargo that the United States defends alone as a kind of legitimate course of action. It is unacceptable to all other members of the world community. But that doesn't stop Washington.
Therefore, we have tasks on the world “stage,” including mobilizing the World Majority to defend their legitimate rights. We are doing this actively within the framework of the Group of Friends for the Defense of the UN Charter, created in 2021. Interest in the work of this Group is only growing. We will strive to ensure that the fundamental principles of the UN Charter are reliably protected from attempts to rewrite international law and replace it with certain “rules”.
The Charter states that the United Nations is founded on the sovereign equality of states. We must call our Western colleagues to account, who have long trampled on this principle and are conducting business as they did in colonial times.
Read in full: https://vk.cc/cuLVqK
#RussiaCuba

description: Soldiers of the 1430th Motorized Rifle Guards Regiment were awarded 'Guard' badges on the front line for their bravery and decisive actions in repelling the summer counter-offensive of the Armed Forces of Ukraine.
original:
The soldiers of the 1430th Motorized Rifle Guards Regiment were solemnly presented with “Guard” badges right on the front line. The commander of the 1430th Guards Regiment solemnly presented “Guard” badges to the soldiers who, with decisive actions and courage, repelled the summer counter-offensive of the Armed Forces of Ukraine.

It is important to remember that the title “Guards” during the Great Patriotic War was awarded only to selected, best army units and units that distinguished themselves in battle.

“Family, friends, colleagues, they are waiting for us at home with victory! And for the regiment, the rank of guards is very important, because this is a status, this is a high assessment for us” - a fighter with the call sign “Mel”. Subscribe to Ramsay!
